channel.title: Hello, Worlds RSS Channel
channel.description: I have always been a fan of the short, witty Science-Fiction vignettes of the early Arthur C. Clarke or Isaac Asimov. And don't get me started on the Genius of Robert Heinlein, or the sheer fun of E.E. 'Doc' Smith. So here is my tribute to all the writers that have given me such joy over the years. If "Vrying Pan", "Travel by Wire", "Resublimated Thiotimoline" and "The Winnowing" mean anything to you, then read on, good visitor!

item.title: A Lensman Dies
item.description: My homage to E.E. 'Doc' Smith's classic 'Lensman' series. Space Opera at its finest!

item.title: An Easter Tale
item.description: How it all began..

item.title: An Infinitude Of Nothingnesses
item.description: I think I'm channelling 'Doc Smith again...with a hat nod to Iain M. Banks, perhaps?

item.title: Better Luck Next Time
item.description: Sometimes it all comes down to luck.

item.title: Captain To The Bridge
item.description: A little piece inspired by io9's Lauren Davis' Concept Art Writing Prompt: A Cat's Eye View of a Spaceship.

item.title: Cruel And Unusual Punishment
item.description: Driving around my neighbourhood the other day, I came across some fresh "street artistry." Here's what I would like to do to whoever inflicted it upon my community and I...

item.title: Dental Floss
item.description: Gather round children, for this bedtime story. Every invention has to have a beginning...of some sort.

item.title: Despair
item.description: A rather black account of Humanity's first successful journey to another star.

item.title: Let's All Get Working
item.description: Arthur C. Clarke's lovely 1937 story "Travel by Wire!" presented a wonderfully optimistic account of how we first got instantaneous travel. This is my take on the theme, consisting of a good serving of 21st century cynicism washed down with a tiny bit of hope.

item.title: Love Is Blind
item.description: Men are from Terra, Women are from Quaxxis.

item.title: Nothing For It
item.description: I rarely recall my dreams but this came to me, fully formed, as I was waking up one cold morning. All I had to do was type it up and there it was. I did have a little fun with the alliteration and punning, though.

item.title: Services Rendered
item.description: Always read the fine print. If you can.

item.title: SOI On Aisle 3
item.description: I hate shopping! My wife loves it, unfortunately! This is my way of rebelling ;-) This is predictive, you mark my words.

item.title: The Choice
item.description: What would you do?

item.title: The Cloth
item.description: A black hooded figure coming out of the fog, offering a piece of black cloth...

item.title: The Halting Problem
item.description: On a recent project, I accidentally wiped the entire computer I was working on by typing 'rm -rf . /*' instead of 'rm -rf ./*'. The extra space makes a lot of difference! This got me thinking about how one might make a hash of things in the future...

item.title: They Also Serve
item.description: Inspired by a discussion regarding the Lens' role in civilization, viz.: is the Lens just a warrior's tool or not?

item.title: Unapologetic
item.description: Newton should have just taken that damnned apple home and made fruit salad.

item.title: Upgrade
item.description: An Asimov robot story. Of a sort...

item.title: Bodgied
item.description: A while back, I was passed on the road by what was obviously a nearly-brand-spankin'-new fire-engine. I say 'nearly' new because someone had quite obviously rectified one small design flaw by taping a tennis ball over a sharp corner with a good helping of duct-tape. This got me thinking...

item.title: A New Day Dawns
item.description: If it can go wrong, it will...

item.title: Sentimental
item.description: A tiny homage to Iain M. Banks' Culture series.

item.title: Patently Obvious
item.description: If only it could be so...

item.title: The Great Hair Scandal
item.description: Hair is just so important to humans, it seems...
